etomica.data

Class AccumulatorAverage

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.data.DataProcessor
      • etomica.data.DataProcessorForked
        • etomica.data.DataAccumulator
          • etomica.data.AccumulatorAverage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataPipe, DataPipeForked, IDataSink, IDataSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccumulatorAverageCollapsing, AccumulatorAverageFixed, AccumulatorAverageFixedOutputFile

    public abstract class AccumulatorAverage
extends DataAccumulator
    Accumulator that keeps statistics for averaging and error analysis. The statistics are incremented with every call to addData. Statistics kept are
    • the value last given to addData
    • the mean, or average
    • the statistical error (68% confidence limits), obtained by standard error analysis of block averages
    • the standard deviation
    • the most recent block average
    • the correlation between adjacent blocks (covariance divided by variance)
    Each statistic is recorded by a Data instance of the same type as the incoming data. The output Data is a DataGroup formed from these Data instances (in the order given above).

    A block is a subset of the input data, formed by grouping (for example) 100 or 1000 successive contributions to addData. Averages for each block are considered to be independent of other block averages, and the confidence interval for the overall average is obtained as the standard error of the mean of these block averages.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AccumulatorAverage.StatType
      Enumerated type that can be used to indicate the statistic to be taken from the accumulator (e.g., average, error, current value, etc.).

      • getData

        public IData getData(AccumulatorAverage.StatType stat)
        Returns a specific element from the DataGroup returned by getData(). Calling getData and extracting the data can be more efficient, while this method can be more convenient.
        Returns:
        an IData object corresponding to the requested StatType.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all sums to zero. All statistics are cleared.
        Specified by:
        reset in class DataAccumulator

        public long getBlockSize()
        Returns:
        the current value of the block size.

      • setBlockSize

        public void setBlockSize(long newBlockSize)
        Sets the size of the block used to group data for error analysis. Resets statistics accumulated so far.
        Parameters:
        newBlockSize - new block size.

      • processDataInfo

        public IDataInfo processDataInfo(IDataInfo incomingDataInfo)
        Prepares the accumulator for input data. Discards any previous contributions to statistics.
        Specified by:
        processDataInfo in class DataProcessor
        Parameters:
        incomingDataInfo - the DataInfo instance for the data that will be given to addData
        Returns:
        dataInfo object for the output of this accumulator.

      • addDataSink

        public void addDataSink(IDataSink newDataSink,
                        AccumulatorAverage.StatType[] types)
        Adds a new DataSink that will receive a specific subset of the statistics generated by this accumulator. The DataSink will be given a DataGroup that has only the specified statistics in it. The output of this accumulator is passed through a DataGroupFilter that removes the unwanted Data.
        Parameters:
        newDataSink - the new DataSink
        types - array indicating the statistics to be included in the DataGroup sent to the sink.

      • getBlockCount

        public long getBlockCount()
        Returns:
        the number of blocks that have been accumulated since construction or the last call to reset.

      • getSampleCount

        public long getSampleCount()
        Returns:
        the number of samples that have been accumulated since construction or the last call to reset.

      • doIncludeACInError

        public boolean doIncludeACInError()
        Returns:
        Flag indicating if auto-correlation is accounted for while calculating the uncertainty.
        See Also:
        setIncludeACInError(boolean)

      • setIncludeACInError

        public void setIncludeACInError(boolean newDoIncludeACInError)
        Include correction to the uncertainty from block correlation function as prescribed in Kolafa, Jiri(1986) 'Autocorrelations and subseries averages in Monte Carlo Simulations', Molecular Physics (59) 1035
        Parameters:
        newDoIncludeACInError - auto-correlation is accounted if true, otherwise it is not.
